metadata.title: CVE-2018-13300 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
In FFmpeg 3.2 and 4.0.1, an improper argument (AVCodecParameters) passed tothe avpriv_request_sample function in the handle_eac3 function inlibavformat/movenc.c may trigger an out-of-array read while converting acrafted AVI file to MPEG4, leading to a denial of service and possibly aninformation disclosure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-13300` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavcodec-extra59 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavcodec59 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavdevice59 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavfilter-extra8 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavfilter8 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavformat-extra - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavformat-extra59 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavformat59 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavutil57 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libpostproc56 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libswresample4 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libswscale6 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
ffmpeg package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6').
mythtv package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
vice package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
gst-libav1.0 package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
